org.apache.mesos.offer.constrain

Class MaxPerAttributeGenerator

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.mesos.offer.constrain.MaxPerAttributeGenerator
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    PlacementRuleGenerator

    public class MaxPerAttributeGenerator
extends java.lang.Object
implements PlacementRuleGenerator
    Ensures that the given Offerâ€™s attributes each have no more than N instances of the task type running on them. For example, this can ensure that no more than N tasks are running against the 'rack:foo' attribute (exact match), or it can ensure that no distinct 'rack:.*' value has more than N tasks running against it (wildcarded grouping). To illustrate, let's look at a deployment scenario of 5 agents with 3 distinct 'rack' values: agent | attr | # tasks -------+--------+--------- 1 | rack:a | 3 2 | rack:b | 2 3 | rack:c | 1 4 | rack:a | 2 5 | rack:b | 2 Given a MaxPerAttributeGenerator with a limit of 5 and a regex of 'rack:.*', let's see what PlacementRule would be produced: In this example, the regex of 'rack:.*' will result in grouping the task counts as follows: - rack:a: 5 tasks - rack:b: 4 tasks - rack:c: 1 task With the limit value of 5, this would result in a PlacementRule that blocks any offers with 'rack:a' from future deployments.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      MaxPerAttributeGenerator(int maxTasksPerSelectedAttribute, AttributeSelector attributeSelector)
      Creates a new rule generator which will block deployment on tasks which already have N instances running against a specified attribute.

    • Method Detail

      • generate

        public PlacementRule generate(java.util.Collection<TaskInfo> tasks)
        Description copied from interface: PlacementRuleGenerator
        Returns a new PlacementRule which defines where a task may be placed given the current deployed state of the system. The returned PlacementRule may then be tested against one or more Offers to find offered resources which match the constraints.
        Specified by:
        generate in interface PlacementRuleGenerator
        Parameters:
        tasks - all currently deployed tasks, against which the returned value is generated
